Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Hit A Home Run !!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelHamptonNH
Reviews.Content: This place is outstanding value, clean and awesome location. Breakfast is very good and offers a little of everything. This property has changed names 3 or 4 times over the years and is the best in service to date. Had a first floor room ( 103 ) that was recently done over and aside from some minor water damage over the interior door, was perfect in every way. Bed were extremely comfortable and a/c was ice cold. Television reception was just fair and internet was not easy to access, but I had my hot spot cell phone, so that was no issue for me. Thanks Comfort Inn for providing an outstanding stay !! Will return for sure !!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: dschmitz
Reviews.Content: We wanted an inexpensive hotel to stay over to visit a few attractions in Orlando. I found on line the comfort Inn that had a very reasonable rate and a continental breakfast that included hot waffles you could make yourself. The hotel had been remodeled and updated and was very clean with comfortable beds. The room was a nice size and the staff were very pleasant to work with. I happened to get a room without a hair dryer, I think it had been stolen and the front desk immediately made sure a brand new one was installed as soon as possible. Across the parking lot within walking distance, was Perkins which was nice for any other meals. Walgreens was also across the parking lot for convenience and other restaurants were very close. I will stay there again to save on hotel rates when all you need is a good place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet place to stay, easy access to major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very clean!!”
Reviews.Author: tam5671
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a sporting event and chose this hotel based on location and the name brand. Not expecting to spend a lot of free time in the hotel, price was a determining factor. WOW, though, I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel from parking lot to the rooms. The rooms were very spacious, and pleasantly decorated. All our questions were quickly answered by the staff and they went out of their way to accommodate our request. The hot breakfast in the morning was stocked well and well maintained by staff, and again very clean. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sharon W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty good, the elevator was slow and there was a wait at the front desk for service but the rooms where alot better then some of the other choice hotels at this exit. The room I was in had a flat screen tv and nice comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “ok place, but won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: mickm23
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just ok, room seemed clean enough, but screaming from down the hall because the girls saw a cockroach made me kind of queasy. the elevator in this place is the slowest I have ever seen! every single time, whether we going up to the room, or going down to the lobby it was unbelievable. front desk seemed to be unmanned most of the time, and the food at breakfast seemed to always be empty and they were slow to fill it back up. what I didn't understand was the placard in the room about saving energy, if you wanted to reuse the towels hang them up. we hung them up everyday and everyday we got fresh towels, even though we wanted the energy saving option.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great price for a school group”
Reviews.Author: Ed R
Reviews.Content: I booked rooms for my school's band and chorus through Choice Hotels Group Reservations long before this hotel's renovation into a Comfort Inn had been completed. Having had several bad experiences booking groups at Comfort Inns in the Orlando area, I was reluctant to use this chain again. After speaking with the office staff, I felt confident that when the renovations were complete, this hotel would be better. Upon my arrival at the hotel, I was pleased with every aspect of our stay. The rooms were newly renovated, with excellent beds, and very clean. The staff was pleasant and accommodating. The location is convenient to Disney, Sea World and Universal. The price we were given through Choice Hotels was excellent. The best recommendation I can give for this property is that the next time I plan a trip to Florida for my band, I plan to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness was an Issue”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: My family and I went on Disney vacation March 2012. The room we got was definitely renovated except bathroom. The tub, toilet, and tiles looked out of place from rest of renovated areas. The room was dirty. The surfaces of the tables and counters felt sticky. There was "stuff" left in toilet which needed to be flushed. The carpet was dirty with crumbs and already looked worn out. We checked out after one night stay. I would not recommend this hotel no matter how cheap it is.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained, newly refurbished”
Reviews.Author: MaraInTO
Reviews.Content: It is very clear that this hotel has been recently refurbished and it is well maintained; still, there is still work to be done. My family of 3 stayed for 2 nights in a double queen room on the 4th floor with new beds, new carpeting and new furniture. There is AC and other amenities (LCD TV, coffee maker/fridge/microwave,ironing board/iron) in the room. Also there is a pool and laundry facilities on the property. The bathroom was not updated so the tub and toilet are older, unlike the rest of the room which is brand new. Beds were very comfortable with very clean sheets and linen. Cannot say the same for the towels. Some of our towels were stained and they were small and not fluffy or absorbent. Towels need to be replaced. Breakfast is very good (waffles, toast,pastries, cereal, juice/coffee) but they have some minor issues to work out (e.g. you have to ask for hot water for tea). We chose this inn because it is set back from the road and it is very well maintained property and I do not like motels with external hallways as they are very noisy. It is also walking distance to restaurants and Walgreens - great plus. It is a 10mins. drive from Hwy 4. (Other motels on SR 192 are right beside the busy main road, are near various attractions that go on into the night, and many look grungy.) We did not experience anything negative at Comfort Inn. For the price we paid, it was a very good deal and for 2 nights it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Negative 5 star review-worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: kiarakitty
Reviews.Content: I was a loyal choice hotels customer until I stayed here In February. Booked my room on their website months in advance- a king bed with whirlpool bath and pull out sofa. Thought it would be fun to be at Disney all day, then let my little girls take a giant bubble bath, to relax and have fun. WRONG. The place is under renovation, rolls of carpet everywhere, smell of paint. Checked into my room, they gave me 2 queen beds. Of course the front desk did not tell me they changed my room. Called them, they said they were all out of the other rooms, gave them away already. Crappy in room phone kept cutting out as well. "System error that happened last week", she said. I told her I changed my room online yesterday. "Oh well the system error happened today". Yeah right, what a lie. Anyway, the front desk said to call the 1800 number. Got transferred to an answering machine. Called again, got transferred to an answering machine. Called a third time, asked for a supervisor, they changed my reservation to only 1 night. WITHOUT A REFUND. I paid more for a suite than a queen bed room yet they won't refund the difference. Emailed them twice already about it. Customer service is CRAP for choice hotel brand. My kids found a lighter under the bed. The air conditioner kept dying on us and making weird noises. If it wasn't so late, I would have left that place ASAP. Stay away from this place. NOT A FAMILY ESTABLISHMENT.

Reviews.Title: “Work in progress - But a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Langley
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers reported, this formerly was a Baymont Inn/Best Western Hotel. Since the transition to Comfort Inn, the hotel has been completely refurbished inside and out. It reopened under its new management in January 2012. As such, many of the earlier reviews may not be relevant. The property is set back from the highway so it will be in your best interest to map it out ahead of time. We used the nearby I-Hop as our landmark as there is no road signage for the hotel. Check in was efficient once I got past the couple who booked through a third party and whose reservation did not make it to the hotel. The lobby was nice but simple. The adjoining breakfast area was also sort of small. Note that as of early February they were still working on the first floor. As a result, that main corridor is blocked for passage. That is the corridor that also leads to the outdoor pool but the February temperatures were not conducive for swimming. The elevator was terribly slow but once we got to the third floor the room was nice. Nice bright corridors too. Flat screen TV, micro/fridge in the room. Comfy beds. And a "towel swan" was sitting on the bed on our arrival - something you do not see at a hotel in this price point. Wireless internet worked well with the laptop but was problematic with my Blackberry Tablet and Smartphone. But that is likely a Blackberry issue. Several points off for ambient noise. The walls are thin. You can hear folks in the adjoining room as well as the corridor. Some University of South Florida students were across the hall and we could hear them pretty distinctly. Our solution was to keep the heater/air conditioning on at low speed. That provided enough white noise to make for good sleeping. Very hot shower and good water pressure too. Breakfast was simple fare and did not vary over our three day stay. Eggs, sausage links, waffle maker and the usual variety of cereal, bagels and some fresh fruit. The breakfast area is smallish. As we were up early it was not an issue but during peak travel season it could be a problem. I did not see a gym or business office, but the first floor (beyond the reception and breakfast area) is still under renovation. Staff was polite. There are several dining options withing walking distance to include the previously mentioned I-Hop and a Perkins. Many more places are on the road but I do not recommend trying to cross Irlo Bronson Highway on foot. All in all, it was an inexpensive and decent stay. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Pleased”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDS
Reviews.Content: We found the Kissimmee Inn to be very pleasant. The room, bathroom, entire hotel was very clean. This hotel was formerly a Best Western and not much has changed other than the name. The reservationist, Pablo, was very accommodating to our wishes. We would most definitely stay here again as we frequently travel to the Orlando/Lake Buena Vista/Kissimmee area throughout the year.

Reviews.Title: “too far from universal”
Reviews.Author: bazlupton
Reviews.Content: my wife,2 step children and i stayed at the Baymont Inn 4156 West Vine Street for a week in August.The Inn is set back off the main highway 192 which is a busy 8 lane highway (and to cross it you have to walk a few hundred yards to the crossing!) Around the Baymont there are plenty of eating places and you get a discount voucher at reception for some of these. 2 supermakets close by too. we had 2 queen size beds, tv microwave and fridge in our room and the rooms were clean and tidy every day. The pool is small but clean and there are towels so you dont need to bring your own. Breakfast is limited,toast and waffles are the only hot dishes on offer (polystyrene tableware and plastic cuttlery) There is a small fitness room with decent equipment. Old town is a must. There is plenty to see and do so go in the evening. If you are planning on going to Disney then there is a shuttle to the parks but if like us you plan to do Universal then you will definately need a car.I didnt hire a car as i drive a lot in England so i spent a fortune on taxi rides. We certainly had a great time and you will be made very welcome by the manager Kamal Faizi and his family (from England). If you are planning to visit Universal then i think this Baymont is too far to travel. Canada Drive seems a good bet

Reviews.Title: “You can get a better room someone else in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: countdowntovacation
Reviews.Content: Room 116 $64.00 + taxes and fees Room was pretty clean. Slow draining bathtub. Mold on shower ceiling. Health Department had closed down the pool and spa area. Person at desk stated that it was because of all the rain. Don't get that! We weren't told this until after we had checked in and walked down to check out the pool area and saw the sign on the locked door and asked at the desk on the way out for dinner. It was a pretty quiet night's sleep. Beds were just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barkeep43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 27 Dec. through to the 1 of January, this year, and had a nice room located on the ground floor. Our children used the hot tub and breakfast was great. Everytime we asked for something from the staff our requests were met. Our room was cleaned every single day, fresh towels and sheets. We would stay again on our next trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “From Bradford going back 2010”
Reviews.Author: BradfordGran
Reviews.Content: Best Western Lakeside Been 2006-2008 first time just my husband and I after a Carnival cruise, the second time with our Daughter, Son-in-law and two grandsons 10-12, Both times were great rooms clean,pools clean ,service e.g cleaning of rooms very good.Serving of food in the pub area can be very slow so have a long drink to pass the time (you will need one after being at the parks all day) pizza hut good, breakfast good but cheaper outside,all in all we found it great thats why we keep going back .

Reviews.Title: “I felt safe”
Reviews.Author: susieqtipOttawa
Reviews.Content: completely satisfied with all staff and service of my stay. Part of my vacation I was alone and never felt threatened in any way. Good shopping close by in all directions. My bed was new and comfortable. Rooms are large. The only disappointment is the pool is not heated, but kept clean. I will definately be back next year so stop by and say hello. Hello to all staff. Lynda Kinnear

Reviews.Title: “Watch out & stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: thefirstreader
Reviews.Content: This was the MOST TERRIBLE and UNSAFE place that I ever stayed. 1. rooms smelled and blanks stained. 2. internet access was a joke. 3. had to changed room TWICE - the toilets flushed for both previous rooms. 4. the car parking next to ours was broken windowed and properties stolen. 5. at 12:00 am two males tried to break in and I called 911. (This hotel was the very first one that I'd ever stayed with closed its front desk at night. The only way to speak with the stuff was through a little slot in (bullet-proof) window just like talking to the prisoned.) 6. NO appology or compensation made!!! Stay away or be prepared to call the police.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!!! It smells and is dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: hollygolightly040
Reviews.Content: This place is disgusting. Never stay here!!! It smells of must and mold and is very dirty. The staff is sketchy and unhelpful. The "business center" consists of a single computer that uses dial-up connection. I checked out after one night. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A newer Best Western next to IHOP.”
Reviews.Author: UAtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Best Western. A pretty good comp continental breakfast with hot items. Our room was huge and had a soaker jacuzzi in the room. it was clean with no issues...except no light in the counter area made it a little dark. The outdoor pool was freezing (mar) but the hot tub was nice. I noticed the maids were a contract company. Mexi-maids or something like that. Everyone we encounterd seemed nice, internet worked. Ample parking. IHOP breakfasts right out your door. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: Neilb62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on a recent trip to tour Florida. The Hotel is set a few yards back from the the I192 road, and can be missed if not careful, however its still accessible from the next junction, yes, we missed it first time! Easy parking to the front and rear. The room (on the 2nd floor) was clean, comfy with fridge, microwave, tv, iron, 2 good sized beds and a small but ok bathroom. Despite being at the front it was quiet, the air-conditioner providing the background noise, however this soon not really noticeable, it didn't keep us awake for instance. There are coin-op laundry facilities on the 3rd floor, we made use of these during our stay and they are fine. A free safety deposit box is available at reception. We didn't use the pool so can't comment, but it looks fine. Breakfast is a self-serve buffet, hot and cold with a good selection varied by the day, and best of all a waffle maker! Plenty of coffee, juice, bagels, french toast etc. Also there is an IHOP and a Perkins nearby for other eating options. A 10-15 min drive from Disney in an area that looks initially a little seedy but turned out to be fine. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Lose Your Money !!!”
Reviews.Author: ANURAGH
Reviews.Content: Beware of this Hotel ! Your CREDIT CARD may GET CHARGED FOR EXTRA DATES !! I am taking up the issue with the Authorities ...

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: NPESFL
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe this hotel has this high of a rating. The room was dirty, and no help from the staff. We were disgusted, and checked out after one night. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimpleJoe
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Best Western toll free number at AAA rates. After reading recent reviews about this hotel I was considering canceling my reservation but instead went ahead and stayed with my wife and 3-year-old son from 04/29/08 through 05/03/08. Check-in upon arrival at the hotel was quick. The women at the front desk was friendly and helpful. We stayed in a room on the first floor with the room window facing the rear parking lot of the hotel property. The room smelled fresh and clean upon entering and there was a microwave and refrigerator that we had requested for and they were in good working condition. The room had 2 queen beds and the bathroom and all the supplies looked good. Free continental breakfast was provided and there was always one person making sure all the breakfast items were available to the hotel guests at all times. The breakfast items were danish,bagel,white and wheat bread, french toast,Kellogg Cereal,Waffle(made fresh with a Waffle maker),orange and apple juices,coffee/tea, syrup,butter and cream cheese, banana. The room was cleaned and beds were made each day of our stay and it was great to come back to a clean room and just sleep after running around all day in the theme parks! Check-out was just as quick as check-in. While driving back to the airport I thought about my decision to cancel my reservation and was really glad that I did not cancel. My stay here was a pleasant one and hope to stay in this hotel again if we visit Orlando area again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoBestWestern
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel if you don't like mushy smell in corridors and inside rooms. Avoid this if you have small kids. Avoid it if you do not like staff that is not co-operative. Avoid if you do not like smell of clorex in hotel towels. I booked this hotel after looking at reviews and 3 damond rating at AAA site. Though our booking was for 4 nights, we left it after first night. As soon as we entered the room, it was smelling weired probably due to lot of air freshner. Specifically smell was very strong near A/C unit. Since we were tired of long travel, thought of giving a second try assuming smell will go away in a while. So went out of the room to get some grocery. Felt immediate difference in quality of air inside and outside. At night when we complained about the smell and requested to transfer to another room, front desk staff was not willing to co-operate. Reason they did not have any maintenance staff at that time. And no available rooms. Instead she came with an air-freshner odor removing spray and tried to kill the smell. And was not willing to refund any money. Very next day, after morning breakfast (which is OK) we transfered to another family friendly hotel. The location of this hotel is not great. It is surrounded by some resort's service area. So there is always some activities going on. Besides the gas station in front had puddle of water filled in always. So please, please avoid this hotel at any cost if you are traveling with friends and family and want to enjoy your vacation. There are hotels available in surrounding area which have quite friendly staff and environment, and may be at better rate.

Reviews.Title: “On second thought....”
Reviews.Author: nkspss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel once before due to the high rating on Trip Advisor, and the relatively low price ($80ish). When we got there, the first time, we thought the hotel was great, and decided on our next trip to Disney that we'd stay there again. This time, it was a little different. We actually got the exact same room as the time before (2-3 months prior), but this time it was a little stinky and when we took off the bed covers, we noticed the sheets and pillows were dirty. We were a little grossed out. We called down to the front and told the lady our situation, she said if we wanted to change the sheets and cases, that we would have to go down and get new ones and do it ourselves as she was the only person there. It was VERY late already and we were exhausted so we said whatever, and let it go. We checked out and got home to find the hotel charge PLUS an additional $50 charge for "extra cleaning", but the thing is, we ONLY slept in the room. Our whole point was that the room wasn't clean, and the owner (Mr. Patel) was trying to make us pay for his poor cleaning staff. We are disputing it right now, both with the hotel and the CC, but they are going downhill fast. It's definitely not as nice as the first time we stayed there, and we won't be back there again. Not worth the money anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, an average Best Western”
Reviews.Author: viomon2
Reviews.Content: I got an internet only special for this hotel through the Best Western website. The room I stayed in was composed of a King bed, fold out double bed and a jacuzzi. The room was well cleaned but musty, my wife has asthma so this was a little problem. The King bed was comfortable and the jacuzzi seemed sanitary. The hotel termed the room "over sized" but I would disagree it was average. The staff was nice and friendly. The only complaint I had was that one of the girls staffing the hotel was always on her cell phone. She was literally always on the hotel phone or her cell phone. Although I never had to wait for her to get off to answer my questions. She just whispered the answers I needed while making sure one hand covered the reliever of the cell phone. Overall I would stay here again. Although, I might try some other properties first. It was nice and close to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “no hot water”
Reviews.Author: 3hvnsnt
Reviews.Content: No hot water/morning ,afternoon ,night. Racoon at swimming pool. wi-fi sometimes works,going to Nickelodean for last 2 days of trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean and close to the parks!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHappytraveler
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for 6 nights and had a very pleasant experience. The breakfast was nice, they had a waffle maker w/ waffle fixings, toast, french toast, biscuits and gravy, sausage, oatmeal, cereal, limited fruit, pastries, eggs, coffee and juices! It is very close to the Disney parks, average drive was about 10 minutes. You have to go to the ticket and transportation center and transfer to a ferry or monorail to get to Magic Kingdom, so that adds some time to your trip there, but don't be put off by the crowds at the ferry/monorail lines, the wait is very short. You can park directly in Epcot, Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios lots, so those are very convenient and quick to get to. The hotel is close to many restaurants and a CVS. Staff was pleasant, the room was spacious and clean (we had a king suite). I would recommend this hotel and return myself for future trips. We booked with a AAA rate at around $110 for the king suite w/ frig. and micro.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, & good place to sleep after long days at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: rchesani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was a good value, convenient to Disney, and it was rated #7 in the area when I booked. Overall I was not disappointed and would stay there again. Not fancy, but comfortable and clean. We arrived at the hotel at about 1:15am. The hotel clerk was on the phone with a very inquisitive caller and it seemed like forever before I was waited on. Once he began checking me in, the phone rang again and after 15 minutes I finally got a room. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and our requests for extra towels and pillow were promptly answered (I left housekeeping sticky notes on the mirror). We were gone everyday to Disney, but the accomodations provided us with 5 nights of peaceful, comfortable rest. The breakfast is good, but the dining area is small. They had biscuits everyday with either sausage gravy or an egg and sausage, made to order waffles, french toast, bagels, toast, bananas, cereal, coffee, milk, and juice. The service of the staff during breakfast is great. They help you get your waffles out of the waffle maker and they are constantly keeping the food filled. We have had some bad experiences booking over the Internet, but this one turned out well!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: Truckerbob
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time to find this place so keep your eyes open. Driving along 192 watch for North Poinciana Boulevard intersection. You will see a Perkins and Ramada, the hotel is behind the Perkins and to the right. So if you turn into the Perkins dive to the back and you will see the hotel to the right. There is also a Knights Inn on Poinciana and I would drive into that hotel then drive through to the Best Western. We found the hotel to be very clean, the room large (we had a king bed), the pool small as well the breakfest area tiny and crowded. We went to Perkins for breakfast after the first morning. The staff very friendly and helpful. There is an area near the front desk going towards the pool where you can check your email if you need to. Easy to get to Disney from the hotel and some shopping close by, lots of places to eat. If your on a budget this is the place to stay. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: mynsanchez
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs some considerable updating. Exterior looks great, inside is another story. Our stay left a lot to be desired but met our purpose - somewhere to sleep for one night. Rooms need to be better kept and breakfast area needs some organization (only so many people fit in the breakfast area at a time). Price for one night's stay worth it if you are planning to spend most of your time at the parks and have no other choice, otherwise way too high in comparison to other facilities we visited in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mwill260
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits back off of I-192. It is a no frills hotel with a nice complimentary breakfast buffet. Several restaurants are within walking distance as well. The pool is small and in the parking lot. Beds were comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: IGDaddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night on November 24, 2007. The room was clean, and very big with 2 queen beds, microwave, mini fridge, and desk with free wireless internet access. The staff was very friendly...after check out I realized that I had left my pillow behind. When I called the hotel and told them my room # they told me I left it behind without me having to ask. They had put it in a plastic bag and held it at the front desk until I returned to pick it up. :) The free breakfast was typical of most places these days with toast, bagels, juices, coffee and a waffle machine. The breakfast space is a bit crowded. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and would stay here again. We had a AAA rate of ~$62+tax.

Reviews.Title: “Was very pleased”
Reviews.Author: pammy7
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Disney, and we researched alot of hotels from reading this site, we were so happy that the reviews on here were accurate. Our room was large, king bed, sofa, small fridge and microwave. Check in and out was fast. Room was clean, that was my main concern. Staff was pleasant enough. Breakfast was fine. Did not use their shuttle service so don't know about that. We would stay again next trip.!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again. Close and convienent!”
Reviews.Author: gwynnetx
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a great value and very close to Walt Disney World. We also went to Universal Studios, which was a quick trip up I-4. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay at this Best Western. Our room was $62.95 a night, AAA rate, and we were there for 5 nights. 2 queen beds, microwave, fridge, tv with cable and showtime, iron, and ironing board. The hotel was generally quiet, except around 9 am or so when the families would get up and head out for the theme parks. Some parents allowed their children to run and scream in the hall, but there wasn't a lot of that, and not when we were sleeping. Free wireless internet connection, if you bring your laptop. No problem with check in or check out. The breakfast was fine. I love the waffle machine. The staff was very attentive in making sure everything was well stocked, and I saw them meticulously cleaning up afterwards. The shuttle to and from Walt Disney World offered times that didn't jive with us, so we were glad we rented a car. But the shuttle is complimentary, in case you're wondering. The drive to the Walt Disney World theme parks took between 7-10 minutes and was a straight shot down highway 192, so the Best Western is in a great location for easy access to Walt Disney World and I-4, if you also want to go to Universal Studios, which we did. It's right behind an IHOP and a Perkins, and very close to a Wal-mart, Target, and a CVS pharmacy. Loads of restaurants and shopping nearby. We'd definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller031
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending 5 days at the Best Western Kissimmee Inn with a girlfriend - we went down to go to Disney, etc. I booked it from the Best Western website, and I think the prices were better online than they were if you simply called the hotel. The hotel was very clean, the bathrooms were clean, and everything in the room worked perfectly. I am a stickler on bathrooms, and I was satisfied with this one - no funny smells or mildew. One thing that was good for us was that the sink was outside the bathroom (so the other person could be taking a shower or using the toilet while the other was brushing teeth), and the sink counter space was huge, so there was enough room for all the toiletries and cosmetics that two women bring. They gave us extra towels and hangers without any problem. The maid service was good as well. We had a 2 queen bed room, and the beds and pillows were comfy, the linens were clean and comfy as well. There was a fridge and a microwave and a large 4 drawer dresser and a desk, and it was pretty roomy. Also there was a coffee pot and hairdryer. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Whenever we asked how to get somewhere, they either whipped out a map and showed us how to go, or gave us prepared directions to major destinations. The breakfast was not terrific, but had all the essentials, plus you could make your own waffles, which was quite nice. We didn't use the pool at all because we were never there during the day, but it looked ok, although it is full sun in the morning and full shadow in the afternoon. The hotel is very well located. about a half hour from the airport, it's set back off a major highway so you don't feel like you are right on the road. There are strip malls galore on that main road, making it easy to find food and a CVS when we needed them. Also, it is a close and an easy drive to Disney and Sea World, which are the only places we went to. If you stay at this hotel, I think that you must have a car, although you could certainly walk to restaurants, etc. The shuttles from the hotel to Disney went only twice a day, I think - I just glanced quickly at the schedule - if you'll be relying on the shuttle, you should check with them on timing and frequency. Also, it would probably be expensive to get to the hotel from the airport (1/2 hour), although I never looked into it. There is an outlet mall within just a few miles, which we enjoyed as well. The hotel is non-smoking, the only place people can smoke on the property is just out front where there are ashtrays outside. Which makes for a clean hotel and property. I would definitely stay there again. Nothing fancy, but clean and roomy and close to everything. And the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Disabled”
Reviews.Author: keith_wright
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 weeks following the reviews on this site. As my wife is in a wheel chair we are always worried about the facilities. We should not have worried - The hotel was everything we expected. The room was large enough to get the chair around and the roll in shower was strong and hot. As others have said there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby - you have to go to Cracker Barrel; turn left out of the hotel and it is a block and half away but does not advertise so it is not in any coupon book but it is worth looking up. The other tip mentioned elsewhere is to look for the big blue IHOP sign, the hotel sign is hidden by trees.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aj2536
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor. the reviews were 100% right. it is clean,quiet, friendly, and the location is great. the hotel is less than 10min to wdw, about 20 to universal.there are many gift shops and places to eat within walking distance. the breakfast was great! they had eggs, sausage, waffles. biscuts and gravy, bagels, danish, toast and cereal. they had a very clean pool and a large hot tub. they are a smoke free hotel,but they have benches out front to set at and smoke. lots of parking, well light. we booked with the hotel web site at $52.99 per night for 2 queens with fridge and micro. make sure you check the internet only rate, it was $10 less per night. we have been to orlando many times and have stayed at many hotels, we will choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: msmall
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night at this hotel, but not because of any problems. We brought a charter bus group to Orlando and they stayed at a villa which did not allow charter bus parking. The hotel was pleasant, but was a bit far from our group so we checked out. The hotel rooms were very clean and spacious. We had a king room and had no problems with it. Carpet was clean, linens were clean, shower and bathroom were clean as well. We had no problems with check-in or check-out. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. We had a king room. The hotel is not a Ritz-Carlton or Omni but it is better than most others in the vicinity. I would definitely stay here again if we came back and were not staying in a villa. During this trip we ended up checking-out early and checking into Radisson Worldgate to be closer to our group, where the conditions were much different. If you are going to be staying in this area, I would advise you to stay at the Best Western Kissimmee Inn - it is worth it. MLS - South Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ali06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly a life-saver! I was having a horrible experience at a near-by hotel. So, I walked over to the Best Western and booked a room for the remainder of my stay in Florida. 7/16/07-7/22/07. What a difference. The rooms were sparkly clean, comfortable, and spacious. The staff was helpful and accommodating. They even helped with directions around town. Great location. Near gas stations, in walking distance to gift shops and restaurants. And it fit my budget. Thanks Best Western! I'll see you again next year. Alison Lawhorn

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay without breaking the bank!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jyni
Reviews.Content: I just want to compliment the Bestern Western Inn at 5196 W. Irlo Bronson Highway in Kissimmee, Florida for providing such a nice place to stay for a moderate price ($80 - $90 price range). This place was everything positive I had read about in Trip Advisor's reviews section!!! I was searching for a place that had good reviews, as far as, cleanliness goes and in my budget . This place definitely stood up to it's reputation on Trip Advisor's reviews. For a moderate price you get: nice clean rooms, laundry room on the premises, vending machines, access to computer, a nice breakfast (juice, milk, coffee, biscuits, eggs, sausages, pastries, toasts, bagels, condiments, cereals, fruits and waffles) and a clean pool. The owner's daughter, Ammi, was very helpful with providing directions and suggestions, as well. If you are looking for a place that's moderate in price, clean, family friendly but not a loud and boisterous type environment with breakfast included, this is your best buy for your money!!!!! I would definitely stay here again!!!!! Thank you Best Western for making me and my son's stay pleasant and memorable!!!!! Sincerely, A Happy Traveler!!! P.S. My only suggestion I have for this place is to get more channels or provide a movie service for extra monies.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mmr42
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS ONE OF THE BEST HOTELS I STAYED IN AT THIS PRICE LEVEL!!! And speaking of price - could not beat it, especially for the services received. We were a family of 4 - 2 adults (30) and 2 kids (6 and 9). Check in was a breeze, right into the room around 3 pm. Rooms were of average size. Nice to have a fridge and microwave. Nothing spectacular but it did the job. AC worked fine. TV had plenty of channels to choose from. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean! Excellent job to the housekeeping staff there! And they were very friendly too! Breakfast was spectacular. You could make your own waffles. Some mornings there were eggs, french toast, danishes, fruit, cereal, the list could go on. Impressive there!!!! The pool is plain and simple but the kids liked it. I used the laundry room once. The dryer ruined some of my clothes and it was very loud. Needless to say I did not use it again. The hotel is very close to everything. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a budget hotel that is very clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean convienient hotel”
Reviews.Author: eseepete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and found it excellent especially considering how reasonable the price is. Great for disney and only 15-20mins on I4 for universal etc. Got a return taxi to citywalk one night for about $55 I think. Yes breakfast can be busy but plenty of food and on till 10 which is great for a late start. Very clean comfortable rooms with loads of space and close to stuff on 192 like IHOP. The swimming pool is small but I didn't use it. It is hard to find the first time - at 192 and ponciana turn into the parking lot behind the perkins/IHOP and you get to the hotel lot from there. Got a refrigerator in my room even though I didnt ask for one but it was great to keep some drinks in. We paid about £200 for the room with breakfast through the best western website.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beachheromichealjane
Reviews.Content: A great stay. the staff is friendly and the rooms are big and clean. this is the sixth time into disney ffor ys and this is the best place we have EVER stayed at. the only thing i found was the elevator is a little slow but that didnt bother my inconvenience too much. the breakfest is the best free one ive had. its breakfest is pretty yummy according to my kids. im coming back here no matter what!! their renovations are great from baymont to bw.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: hapitrvlr
Reviews.Content: This was once the Baymont Inn (as per the elevator inspection card). It's now part of the Best Western 'family' and the renovations are awesome! Everything has been changed/updated. It was, however, alittle hard to find. It's off 192 East (aka Irlo Bronson Hwy) between mile markers 10 & 11; just behind the IHOP.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel great Price - stayed at Comfort Night befor”
Reviews.Author: meza559
Reviews.Content: A great hotel on the US-192. A little hard to find set back off of the road. We stayed at the Comfort Inn which in #1 in the area the night before and they were sold out the next night. I honestly think this hotel should be number one knowing its a much smaller hotel, quieter, there cleaniness, MUCH MORE HELPFUL AND HAPPIER staff, and their breakfest buffet is great for my family and me. paid $139 during spring berak which isnt bad at all. recommended hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “They changed the name, it now might be even better!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Impala guy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again. Was surprized that it was now a Best Western from a Baymont Inn. No problems here and by the looks of the full parking lot they were doing well (we had a early morning flight). Once you find a place like this there is no reason to go anywhere else! My nightly rate was very competitive, too, Lots of good places to eat are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Blonniew
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Best Western(formally the Baymont). It was great!! The price 85.00 a night. The rooms were so clean! You get a free breakfast in the morning, Waffles, Sausage Gravy, Toast, Danish, French Toast! And of course coffee and juice. The staff, I think just one family, Were so nice! Free computer to use. They even printed our E-Tickets for us the day before we left. Great Place!!!! We will go back next year. I really can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Baymont now Best Western Kissimmee terrific value”
Reviews.Author: stshack
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with our choice to stay here. We chose based on previous tripadvisor.com reviews. We had a bit of trouble finding the hotel at first.Here is what to look for, the building is a beige 4 story stucco Baymont sign in the picture is no longer on the building, it is now Best Western, Kissimmee Inn on 192 also called Irlo Broson Hwy but street signs are marked 192. Hotel is behind the IHOP Staff is friendly and helpful, room is very clean, even though we are in the front 2nd floor above the entrance our room is quiet.Free internet access in rooms, computer available just off the lobby. Pool and hot tub. There is a free shuttle to DisneyWorld and Universal but we used our rental car. Free breakfast in lobby seats about 20, pastries, breads [toaster available] make your own yummy waffles,biscuits and gravy, cereal and bananas, juice ,coffee and tea. Several restaurants within walking distance, Ruby Tuesday, Macaroni Grill, Chili's, Longhorn Steakhouse, and IHOP in front of the hotel. Also near CVS drugstore and lots of discount souvenir stores. My husband and I feel very comfortable walking to the restaurants after dark.Go early or late the restraunts are busy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Motel!!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieK961
Reviews.Content: The Baymont-Inn is one of the greatest motels I have stayed in Kissimmee. We come up to Disney just about every year this time and try a different motel each time [I guess that won't be happening anymore due to our love for Baymont]. The breakfest was very nice, even though it's just a bit small. They offer eggs, sasuage, bagels w/chesse, toast, cereal [which is great for the kids], hot/fresh waffles, milk, juice, and much more. The young lady at the front desk was very helpful and polite. After all that excitement we found out the day of check-out the motel will be becoming a BEST WESTERN KISSIMMEE INN. I meet the owner on-site. We were told that the rooms have have just recently renovated and they did look brand new. The bathrooms were spotless. It's hardly ever that you'll find a motel like this in the area, so give it a stay. -Charlie K.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Pudge
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel to stay in for 1 night prior to my checking into an on-site Disney hotel for a 9 night stay. Chose the Baymont due to the positive reviews that it received on trip advisor. This hotel recently changed its name to Best Western and has also done some remodeling (carpets, etc) even though it is a fairly new hotel. For the $62 per night rate I received, you can't beat it. Please note that the hotel is nothing fancy, it is a budget type of accomodation, but it is clean, has decent sized rooms, and offers a continental breakfast which I found to be excellent (although the breakfast area is very small). It also has an outdoor pool which is not heated, and a nice hot tub. What more could you ask for? The hotel is set back from busy 192 and you can't hear any noise from traffic. It is also close to Disney World. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, especially after reading some reviews of other budget type accomodations on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel after a horrible night nextdoor at the Ramada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 1st floor, clean, clean cleaner than clean. Especially after a horrible stay at a nextdoor Ramada Hotel the night prior. This Hotel is only 5 years old and it shows. I would recommend a stay there anytime. Pool is fun enough to cool off at night after a long day at the Theme Parks. For $ 69 you really can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better.”
Reviews.Author: Brokertrainer
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews here, we expected a nicer hotel. Check in was efficient but impersonal. The first floor room we received had dated water stains on wall near window. They appeared to be old rain water leaks or perhaps from a/c unit in room directly above ours. Room was relatively clean but had a musky scent probably due to moisture. It rained during our stay and each time the carpet near the window was soaked. One of the queen mattresses was very worn. In sitting on the corner of the bed, you could almost slide all the way to the ground the mattress was so worn. This is probably what a one star hotel should be. Although, considering and comparing to how bad some of the surrounding hotels in Kissimmee are, it would probably get 2 stars. For around $65/night, would probably only stay here again if we had no other choice. However, after we had left town, the staff did help us find and retrieve an item that we had accidentally left in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: Chiquita50
Reviews.Content: We stayed there while we went to the Disney World, it was a great location not too far from the attractions, and a great breakfast was included. The rooms were clean, and very nice! It was not too expensive and we had a great time. I didn't go to the pool but I think it was pretty ok. Would definitively go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Easter at Baymont Inn Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: yogianddaisy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Baymont Inn Kissimmee 8-15 April. Excellent value for money. Good size room - microwave & fridge included. Cleaned daily so no complaints there. No sitings of ants, cockroaches or other bugs! Breakfast buffet adequate but area too small and too many people - take toast, bagels, cereals back to your room. Coffee on tap all day long. Only complaint is the pool which is FREEZING (came to the conclusion that its built on the wrong side of the hotel. Hot tub perfect! Staff friendly. Free internet and newspaper. Plenty of parking spaces available. IHOP and Perkins opposite. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DonB859
Reviews.Content: So far, so good. I am currently staying at the Baymont Inn and am very pleased with the hotel and staff. The room is clean, a good size for my family of four (two queen size beds with a work table/chair). AC works well, mini fridge and microwave do the job and the continental breakfast is above average. They have the fresh waffle maker, cereal, fruit, juice machine, coffee and today eggs, sausage and biscuits. Not bad at all. The hotel is set back off 192 enough to provide "privacy". Wireless high speed internet works great in the room and there is one work station on the first floor for those that don't bring their own laptop. Haven't tried the outdoor pool or whirlpool yet but the week is young. Will keep you posted.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good!”
Reviews.Author: Joe2316
Reviews.Content: I should start this review by saying that we usually stay at more upmarket hotels (four and five-star) so our expectations are fairly high. We were not expecting much from this hotel because of it's budget price point. However we were pleasantly surprised. The furnishings and carpets are in very good order and I think the hotel must be fairly new given its overall condition. Our room was larger than we expected and all the essentials were there, but the beds are not king size, just queen sized. The bathroom was also clean and tidy, the bed linens were fresh and everything smelled clean. Housekeeping were efficient and friendly at all times. The shower pressure was good, even on the top floor. The Baymont also has free wired/wireless Internet access in the hotel rooms, which is something we did not expect at this price. The only negative side is the breakfast area, which is surprisingly small. This can mean that you have to queue up or wait for a table if you do not time things right. The breakfast selection, although small does include at least one a hot item and the choice of four cereals and various pastries, bagels and bread. You have to be quick to get fruit as it is quite limited. As we usually have a light breakfast anyway, this did not prove to be a problem, but if you have fussy kids or a large appetite then it may be worth taking a trip to one of the many local chains who serve huge breakfasts for little money! We did not use the pool as it was January, so cannot comment on it. The hotel is just off the 192 Highway and approximately 10-15 Minutes Drive from the main Disney complex. It's also close to a multitude of restaurants and shops. I can recommend the Olive Garden and Smokey Bones, both within walking distance. Perhaps the best recommendation can come from the fact that we did not need to contact management or housekeeping at any time during our stay to correct an issue, as everything was right first time! Very highly recommended, I reckon about the same quality as a Hampton Inn but at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the King Size Bed & Free Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: winniepoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the nice reviews and now we know why. The Baymont was clean, the room was huge, the staff was friendly and the location was minutes from Epcot and Animal Kingdom (we drove ourselves). We took advantage of the fridge and enjoyed the complimentary water and brownies. We ate at Artist Point, also because of the nice reviews, and it was delicious. Pricey, but a nice experience. We could only get a reservation for 9 but they sat us at 7:30. We also ate at a Thai place (forget the name) close to Sea World on Int'l Drive that was very nice. Make a reservation if you want a booth.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5196 W. Irlo Bronson Hwy., Kissimmee, FL 34746 (Formerly Kissimmee Inn)
